N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 204.4 - Facility use, maintenance, design

State Regulations
(a) Use of natural organic reduction facility. A natural organic
reduction facility shall be used exclusively for the natural organic reduction
of human remains. (b) Cleanliness. A natural organic reduction facility shall be
maintained in a clean, orderly and sanitary manner, with adequate
ventilation. (c) Privacy. The area in which natural organic reductions occur
and the temporary storage facility shall be separately enclosed areas and when
fully closed, the interior of one area shall not be visible from within the
other area. (d) Temporary

Storage Facility. Every natural organic reduction facility shall have
a temporary storage facility. Such temporary storage facility shall be
adequately ventilated; shall comply with all applicable public health laws
regarding the proper handling and storage of human remains and body fluids; shall be operated and maintained in a manner which protects the health and
safety of natural organic reduction facility personnel; and shall be secure
from access by anyone other than authorized persons. Notes
